<JD_START>
Job Title: Sourcing Manager

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Reports to: Director of Production & SourcingLocation: Hybrid Remote / New York CityTo apply: https://apply.workable.com/j/C511783C3B
Nice to meet you!Pepper is a DTC fast-growing, unabashedly confident bra brand intentionally designed to celebrate small chested bodies in all their glory. We‚Äôre on a mission to empower small-chested women of all body types to embrace the flat in flattering. Since launching our 470% funded Kickstarter in 2017, we‚Äôve sold more than a million bras in 2022 alone, and have gone viral and been featured in Cosmopolitan, Glamour, Forbes, Oprah Daily, Vogue and many more.
What we‚Äôre proud of:
Small & mighty. Without raising traditional VC dollars, we‚Äôve grown to eight figures in sales in just 5 short years through focused and profit-minded strategies.Doing big things. Our vision is to create a world where ‚Äòflat‚Äô is no longer an insult, and where we take over our customer‚Äôs closet with solution-driven, highly curated, fit-first apparel.Good for people & the planet. We are intentional about our impact, from how we give back to communities all the way to our factory workers and the women who make our bras. Read more about our sustainability here.
This is where you come in.
We are looking for an experienced, detail-oriented, and passionate intimate apparel Sourcing Manager. You will take a lead role in collaborating with design and production in developing our intimates product (Bras, Undies and adjacent categories of Athleisure, Lingerie and Swim). You are a strategic thinker who can assess tradeoffs between short and long term resources and are able to roll up your sleeves and support every aspect of our product development process from raw material sourcing to working with our suppliers and manufacturers to deliver a product that meets our high standards in quality, design and cost. 
Responsibilities: 
Source, develop, and manage all raw materials including pre-costing, fabrics, washes, trims, prints, and mock-ups.Source new manufacturers to meet product development initiatives Gather and review fabric submits, FDS / FIS sheets, and test reports to ensure all Sample yardage and bulk fabrics meet specificationsReview bulk test reports to ensure fabric specifications are metAttend potential trade shows and build a raw materials vendor baseWork with Design to develop and maintain physical fabric library for PepperSupport design to establish and maintain color palettes and lab dip libraries seasonally. Order, track, and monitor all lab dip and print strike off comments to meet calendar deadlines.Support the product development process collaborating with internal and external cross-functional partners to deliver products that meet design, engineering, quality and cost goals.Daily e-mail and Zoom communication with mills and factories to troubleshoot product development issues and advise solutions.Daily communication with cross-functional teams - Design / Planning / Product / Production. Coordinate with the Production team for a smooth transition from product development to order placing.
The perfect fit.
The ideal candidate is passionate about Pepper‚Äôs mission to promote body confidence for our audience, fit-driven and can roll up their sleeves to flawlessly execute on strategy.
Excellent communication skills and is proactive in their approach to problem solving.8-10 years of experience in intimates product development/raw materials role with strong knowledge of fabric constructions and finishes.Strong knowledge of intimate, active and swimwear productExperience sourcing raw materials with Western Hemisphere and AsiaLives in NYC area and able to meet in person with Production & Design team, as neededExperience in ASTM Fabric Testing for all product types.Analytical, detail-oriented, and organized, with the ability to multitask and reprioritize workload/ projects to meet deadlinesProven ability to effectively negotiate with mills and manufacturersProficient in Google Apps, Microsoft Office and online collaboration tools like SlackExtremely flexible and adaptive to changing prioritiesPassion for start-ups, ecommerce, and rapid growth a mustValid Passport for international travelSpanish language a plus
Pepper values.We Set the New Standard üèÜ: We challenge ourselves to always do better than the status quo and are not afraid to think outside the box.We Care Hard üí™: We do hard things with empathy, collaboration, compassion, and don‚Äôt shy away from tough feedback or situations.We Believe No Job‚Äôs Too Big or Small üóª: We roll up our sleeves, and are able to do a lot with a little through creative problem solving and resourcefulness.We Embrace Flexible Conviction üí´: We don‚Äôt hold back, and believe the best decisions are ones made together with conviction and openness.
The perks.Company matched 401K plan up to 3%100% company covered option for medical, vision, dental insurance premiumsFlexible remote work locationFlexible and generous vacation policyPaid parental leave for qualifying employeesHealth & wellness monthly stipendHave a huge role in the growth of a company with a meaningful mission
DiversityPepper is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Pepper's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religious creed, sex, gender identity, marital or veteran status, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member), sexual orientation, pregnancy, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. It also prohibits discrimination based on a perception that anyone has any of those characteristics, or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics. All such discrimination is unlawful. Pepper will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal history, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
What Personal Information We CollectProfessional, employment-related, or schooling information. Current or past job history, performance evaluations, and educational background, including grades and transcripts. How We Use Your InformationFor professional, internal analysis, or employment-related purposes, including job applications.
If you are a Colorado or New York resident, please email us at dreamjobs@wearpepper.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include the job title in the subject line of the email.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
